## Comparing personal preferences and bitterness for **CoffeeC**

::: {#317714b6 .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv("../../data_sources/coffee_survey.csv")
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
sns.catplot (data = df, 
             x = "coffee_c_personal_preference",
             y = "coffee_c_bitterness",
             kind = "box")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![](coffee_files/figure-html/cell-2-output-1.png){width=487 height=470}
:::
:::


## **Distribution of Age**

::: {#1e861a24 .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
sns.displot(data = df, y = "age")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![](coffee_files/figure-html/cell-3-output-1.png){width=470 height=470}
:::
:::


## **Distribution of Favourite coffee**

::: {#5f55faee .cell execution_count=3}
``` {.python .cell-code}
sns.displot(data = df,
            y = "favourite",
            binwidth = 1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![](coffee_files/figure-html/cell-4-output-1.png){width=471 height=470}
:::
:::


## **Favourite coffee based on gender**

::: {#f8a98551 .cell execution_count=4}
``` {.python .cell-code}
sns.displot(data = df, x = "gender", y = "favourite")
plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4}
```
([0, 1, 2, 3, 4],
 [Text(0, 0, 'Other (please specify)'),
  Text(1, 0, 'Female'),
  Text(2, 0, 'Male'),
  Text(3, 0, 'Non-binary'),
  Text(4, 0, 'Prefer not to say')])
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![](coffee_files/figure-html/cell-5-output-2.png){width=468 height=571}
:::
:::


## **Preferred Coffee Style**

::: {#62b078f0 .cell execution_count=5}
``` {.python .cell-code}
names = ['Pourover', 'Latte','Drip coffee', 'Cappuccino', 'Espresso','Cortado','Americano', 'Iced coffee', 'Mocha','Cold brew','Other', 'Blended drinks']
size = [1026, 654, 415, 330, 309, 295, 238, 147, 116, 108, 105, 45]
# Create a circle at the center of the plot
my_circle = plt.Circle( (0,0), 0.7, color='white')
# Give color names
plt.pie(size, labels=names, colors=['red','green','blue','skyblue'])
p = plt.gcf()
p.gca().add_artist(my_circle)
 
# Show the graph
plt.show()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![](coffee_files/figure-html/cell-6-output-1.png){width=517 height=389}
:::
:::
